message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.SI 

Reasoning: The paper explores the idea of maximizing expected utility in authoring a piece of text, which is a concept that is relevant to natural language processing and computational linguistics (cs.CL). The authors also use a random utility model to explicitly model the goals of amici curiae, which is a technique commonly used in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also involves societally important decisions and counterfactual analysis, which could fall under the categories of cybernetics (cs.CY) and social and information networks (cs.SI).
